text: Draught at Stockholm Beer and Whisky Festival 2010. Hazy orange color. Sweet lemony and hoppy aroma with notes of apple. Dry bitter, toffeish and lemony flavor. Full body and chewy mouthfeel,  not so drinkable.

Draught at BA Vasagatan
Hazy orange with a small, white head.
Fruity and creamy with medium bitterness. Smooth and pleasant.
Courtesey of rlgk (I think). Very refreshing aroma with citrus, pine and pineapple. More of the above in the rich taste w sweet malts that balance the bitter ending very good. A nice brew.
Draught. Low fluffy off-white quickly disappearing head. Hazy dark brown body. Pretty hoppy malty nutty aroma and flavor with a dry hoppyness that is lingering for a long time. Low carbonation.

Aroma is fruits, some slight bready maltyness along with herbs and a bit salty notes as well. Flavour is being quite much the same along with some slight earth and cellary notes.
hay, floral, grass, pale, golden, hazy, frothy, light sweetness, medium bitterness, lightly sour, salty, medium body, oily feel, soft carbonation, bitter,
Draft @ Green Lion Inn, Malmö. Pours a hazy orange color small off-white head. Has a fruity malty hoppy aroma. Fruity malty hoppy bitter citrus flavor. Has a fruity malty hoppy bitter citrus finish.

(Draught at Stockholm Beer Festival, 2 Oct 2010) Amber colour with frothy, beige head. Fruity, malty nose with notes of fresh hops, grainy malt, orange and citrus peel. Fruity, malty, hoppy taste with orange peel, dried apricots and hints of pine needles. More than medium body, fairly sweet. Generous bitterness with lots of fresh hops. Refreshing and very nice.

Draught at SBWF. Pours out in a hazy amber colour with a rich rocky white head. Dryish and rather hoppy aroma of lemon-zest, nuts, toasted malts, orange-peels and grapefruit. Medium-bodied with notes of orange-peels, resin, mint, grapefruit and mild cocoa. Medium-bitter finish of mint and orange-peels with hints of nuts and milky chocolate. A nice take on the style.
Draught at SBWF (Brill). It poured a hazy golden liquid with a creamy white head. Fruity smell. Weak taste and light body. But fresh and easy to drink.
Draught at Stockholm Beer Festival.  Hazy amber, creamy head. Fruity nose with some minerals.Medium bodied with lively mouthfeel and ashy bitterness. Feels fresh and nicely drinkable.

@ Bishops Arms Vasagatan, Stockholm. Hazy yellow and a yellowish head. Aroma is hopy, floral, has grapes and some sweet apples. Flavor is filled with tropical hops and the aftertaste is quite long and bitter.
Draught at BA Vasagatan, Stockholm. Hazy orange color, beige head. Hoppy soapy aroma, creamy and fruity notes. Fruity, soapy, grassy flavor.

Draught @ Norrebro Bryghus, Ryesgade 3, 2200 Copenhagen, Denmark.Light light unclear medium orange color with a average, frothy to creamy, good lacing, mostly lasting, off-white head. Aroma is moderate malty, toasted - caramel, moderate hoppy, citrus - orange, fruity, light yeasty, light overripped fruit, overripped apple notes. Flavor is moderate sweet and bitter with a average to long duration, fresh. Body is medium, texture is oily, carbonation is soft. [20100821]

Draught.  Nice hazy deep golden-orange look with a nice white ehad. Fresh fruity piney hoppy sweet aroma. Good mouthfeel indeed. Fruity sweetish pine grass flavour with a well alsting dry bitter finish. Tasty brew indeed.

On tap. Clear deep golden - bordering amber - with a small off-white head leaving some laces. The aroma is fruity with lots of caramel and some citrusy hops. Medium-bodied with a fairly high caramel sweetness overpowering most of the bitterness. 050810

Tap @ Lord Nelson. Pours amber, slightly hazy with a white head. Smells like bitter fruitcake. The taste is kind of bitter with a long aftertaste. Notes of flour, grapefruit, citrus. Medium bodied. Creamy texture. My first beer from Croocked Moon and a very good summer beer.
Clear golden with a large off white head. Hoppy nose wth malt and fruity notes. Dry and hoppy flavor with notes of pine grapefruits and malt. Finished dry and bitter. Good drinkability.

Draft. Unclear dark golden beer with a lazing beige head. The aroma has notes of fruit, malt, caramel, and peaches. The flavor is sweet with notes of malt, fruit - peaches at first, but towards the end a strong overwhelming note of green apples attacks the palate, leading up to a lemony and hop bitter finish.
Draught at NB. Clear dark amber - white head. Grassy. Cactus. Light fruuty notes. Dryness. Medium malty. Bread. Knækbrød (swedish flatbread). Toasted. Nice bitterness. Light forrest - wood. Nice.

Draught at Nørrebro Bryghus.
Hazy orange coloured with a creamy white head.
Fruity aroma of hops, pine needles and rgass with notes of yeast.
Fruity flavour of hops, grape fruits and cardemomme with notes of grass and yeast.
Dry hoppy finish.

From tap at Nørrebro Bryghus. Pours hazy orange with a lacing and thick white head. Aroma is citrusy and mild grapefruity with a light grassy note. Classic common malty note too. Distinct hoppy and classic california common malt/yeast base. Bitter and bone dry finish. Atypical for the style, but nice.
